sec.p: Table 1 shows the characteristics of the 72 survey respondents. Overall response rate was 55.0%, ranging from 35.5% to 81.3% across cohorts. The sample included 66% women. Respondents’ self-identified race and ethnicity included 64.8% White, 18.3% Asian, 9.9% Black, and 7.0% Latino. When starting the FLC, the mean years a participant had been a UCSF faculty member was 10.8 years (SD = 6.8; range 1–27 years). One-third reported research as their primary faculty role, other primary roles included clinical service (18.8%), administration (18.8%), teaching (17.4%), or multiple primary roles (11.1%).
